p: Essential oils have been used since ancient times. Over the years, EOs have been approved for use in cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, perfumery and food and medicine industries, and are some of the most commonly used natural products. On the other hand, aromatherapy, a branch of alternative medicine, argues that essential oils can be particularly active healing remedies with specific actions for various maladies. Moreover, they can be a natural alternative to synthetic drugs, which produce countless side effects. Today, by combining science with ancient wisdom, we can gain a deeper understanding of and, at the same time, access to the therapeutic benefits that essential oils possess [ 8]. The essential oils of basil and lavender are among the best known because of their applicability in various fields of activity. Lavender EOs contains volatile molecules of particular interest to the cosmetics industry, perfumes and aromatherapy, while basil EOs are commonly used in the food industry.
